trans-unit.source:
\n

Represents a key-level node in the Windows registry.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxx x xxx$xxxxx xxxx xx xxx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This class is a registry encapsulation.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The handle to the registry key.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The registry key is closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
Closed keys cannot be accessed.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The user does not have the necessary registry rights.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A system error occurred, such as deletion of the current key.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxx$ xxxx xx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The user does not have the permissions required to read the key.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Retrieves the name of the key.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

The absolute (qualified) name of the key.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

Retrieves the count of subkeys of the current key.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of subkeys of the current key.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The user does not have read permission for the key.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxx xxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The user does not have the necessary registry rights.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A system error occurred, for example the current key has been deleted.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

Retrieves the count of values in the key.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of name/value pairs in the key.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The user does not have read permission for the key.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxx xxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The user does not have the necessary registry rights.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A system error occurred, for example the current key has been deleted.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the view that was used to create the registry key.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Creates a new subkey or opens an existing subkey for write access.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name or path of the subkey to create or open.

trans-unit.source:
This string is not case-sensitive.

trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxx$xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

\n

\nsubkey is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.

\n

The user does not have the permissions required to create or open the registry key.

trans-unit.source:
\n

trans-unit.source:
This string is not case-sensitive.

\n

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

Deletes the specified subkey, and specifies whether an exception is raised if the subkey is not found.

trans-unit.source:

This string is not case-sensitive.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxx$xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates whether an exception should be raised if the specified subkey cannot be found.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source: If this argument is true and the specified subkey does not exist, an exception is raised.
trans-unit.target: Xx xxxx xxxxxxxx xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: If this argument is false and the specified subkey does not exist, no action is taken.
